SEARCH
Module org.myjtools.jexten.plugin
Package org.myjtools.jexten.plugin

Class ValidationResult

java.lang.Object
org.myjtools.jexten.plugin.ValidationResult
public final class ValidationResult extends Object
Represents the result of validating a plugin manifest.

A validation result can be either valid (no errors) or invalid (one or more errors). Multiple validation results can be combined using merge(ValidationResult).

Usage Examples


 // Create a valid result
 ValidationResult valid = ValidationResult.valid();

 // Create an invalid result with errors
 ValidationResult invalid = ValidationResult.invalid("Missing required field");

 // Create with multiple errors
 ValidationResult errors = ValidationResult.invalid(List.of(
     "Invalid version format",
     "Unknown extension point"
 ));

 // Combine results
 ValidationResult combined = result1.merge(result2);

  • Method Details

    • valid

      public static ValidationResult valid()
      Creates a valid result with no errors.
      Returns:
      a valid ValidationResult

    • invalid

      public static ValidationResult invalid(String error)
      Creates an invalid result with a single error message.
      Parameters:
      error - the error message
      Returns:
      an invalid ValidationResult

    • invalid

      public static ValidationResult invalid(List<String> errors)
      Creates an invalid result with multiple error messages.
      Parameters:
      errors - the list of error messages
      Returns:
      an invalid ValidationResult, or valid if the list is empty

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Returns whether this result represents a valid state (no errors).
      Returns:
      true if valid, false if there are errors

    • errors

      public List<String> errors()
      Returns the list of error messages.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of error messages (empty if valid)

    • merge

      public ValidationResult merge(ValidationResult other)
      Merges this result with another, combining all errors.

      If both results are valid, returns a valid result. If either or both have errors, returns an invalid result with all errors combined.

      Parameters:
      other - the other validation result to merge
      Returns:
      a new ValidationResult containing errors from both results
